Mexican Street Corn Casserole

Jump to Recipe

Mexican Street Corn Casserole is a vibrant and delicious dish that brings the flavors of traditional Mexican street corn, or 'elote', right to your dinner table. This hearty casserole features a creamy blend of corn, cheese, and spices that creates a comforting and satisfying meal perfect for any occasion. Whether you're hosting a casual family dinner, preparing for a festive gathering, or simply craving a taste of Mexico, this casserole is sure to impress. The combination of frozen corn, cream cheese, and a medley of bold seasonings delivers a rich flavor profile that will tantalize your taste buds. Plus, it's incredibly easy to prepare, making it an ideal choice for busy weeknights or potluck parties. In this article, we’ll walk you through the simple steps to create this crowd-pleaser, as well as tips for customizing the recipe to suit your preferences. Get ready to elevate your mealtime with this scrumptious Mexican Street Corn Casserole!

Ingredients

frozen corn

If you don't have frozen corn, you can use canned corn (drained) or fresh corn. If using fresh corn, cook it until tender before adding it to the mixture.

cream cheese

For a lighter option, you can substitute with Greek yogurt or low-fat cream cheese. Make sure to soften the cream cheese before mixing for a smoother consistency.

sour cream

You can substitute sour cream with plain yogurt or a dairy-free alternative like cashew cream for a vegan option. This will still provide creaminess to the casserole.

shredded cheddar cheese

Feel free to mix different cheeses, such as Monterey Jack or Pepper Jack for a spicier kick. Grate your own cheese for better melting quality.

cotija cheese

If you can't find Cotija cheese, feta cheese is a great substitute. It provides a similar salty flavor and crumbly texture.

chili powder

Adjust the amount of chili powder according to your spice preference. You can also use smoked paprika for a different flavor profile.

cumin

Cumin adds a warm depth; if you're out, you can use ground coriander as a substitute, but it will change the flavor slightly.

garlic powder

If you prefer fresh garlic, use 1-2 cloves of minced garlic instead. This will enhance the flavor more robustly.

salt

Start with a small amount and adjust to taste, especially if using cheese, as they can add additional saltiness.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper offers the best flavor. Adjust the amount based on your heat tolerance.

fresh cilantro

If you are not a fan of cilantro, you can substitute it with fresh parsley or omit it altogether. It adds a fresh note to the dish.

lime juice

Fresh lime juice is ideal, but bottled lime juice can work in a pinch. For extra zing, add some lime zest along with the juice.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the oven

    Set your oven to 350°F (175°C) to ensure it reaches the right temperature for baking. This is crucial for even cooking.

  • Step 2: Prepare the mixing bowl

    In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of frozen corn, 8 oz of cream cheese, 1 cup of sour cream, and 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Add 1/2 cup of Cotija cheese, 1 tsp of chili powder, 1 tsp of cumin, 1/2 tsp of garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste. Mix thoroughly until the ingredients are well combined. Tip: Use a hand mixer for a smoother consistency, especially with the cream cheese.

  • Step 3: Transfer to baking dish

    Pour the corn mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Spread it evenly across the dish to ensure uniform cooking. Note: Greasing the dish prevents sticking and makes for easier cleanup.

  • Step 4: Add cheese topping

    Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the casserole. This will create a delicious, cheesy crust once baked.

  • Step 5: Bake the casserole

    Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes. The casserole is done when the cheese is bubbly and golden brown. Tip: Keep an eye on it during the last few minutes to prevent burning.

  • Step 6: Garnish and serve

    After removing the casserole from the oven, drizzle with 2 tbsp of lime juice and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of chopped fresh cilantro for a burst of flavor. Serve hot and enjoy! Note: Lime juice adds a zesty flavor that complements the richness of the cheese.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the frozen corn for the casserole?

You can use frozen corn directly in the recipe without thawing. Just measure out 2 cups and add it straight to the mixing bowl.

Can I use other types of cheese instead of Cotija?

Yes! If you can’t find Cotija cheese, you can substitute with feta or even more cheddar cheese for a different flavor.

What’s the best way to mix the cream cheese with other ingredients?

Let the cream cheese sit at room temperature for about 15-20 minutes before mixing. This will soften it and make it easier to combine with the other ingredients.

How do I know when the casserole is done baking?

Check for bubbly cheese and a golden top. You can also insert a knife in the center; if it comes out hot, the casserole is ready!

What can I do if I don’t have lime juice?

You can substitute lime juice with lemon juice or even vinegar if you're in a pinch. It will add a bit of acidity that complements the dish.

Is there a way to make this casserole a little spicier?

Absolutely! You can add diced jalapeños to the mixture or increase the amount of chili powder to suit your taste.

How should I store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3-4 days. You can reheat it in the oven or microwave.

Can I make this casserole ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the casserole up to the baking step, cover it, and refrigerate it for up to 24 hours. Just bake it when you’re ready to serve.

What’s the best way to chop fresh cilantro?

Rinse the cilantro under cold water, shake off excess moisture, then bunch the leaves together and use a sharp knife to chop. You can also use kitchen scissors for a quick chop!

Do I have to use all the spices listed?

No, you can adjust the spices according to your preference. If you're unsure, start with less and add more as needed.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This casserole can be adapted for various dietary preferences. To make it gluten-free, ensure all ingredients, particularly the spices, are certified gluten-free. For a lighter version, substitute low-fat cream cheese and sour cream. For a vegan option, replace cream cheese and sour cream with cashew cream or a vegan sour cream alternative, and use a non-dairy cheese for topping. Additionally, consider using nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor without dairy.

Pairings

For a delightful meal, serve the Mexican Street Corn Casserole with grilled chicken or shrimp seasoned with lime and garlic to complement the flavors of the casserole. For a vegetarian option, consider black beans or sautéed zucchini. Pair it with a refreshing beverage like a chilled Mexican lager, margarita, or a non-alcoholic hibiscus tea, which will enhance the dish's vibrant flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the casserole warm in a vibrant dish to showcase its colorful ingredients. Garnish each serving with additional fresh cilantro and lime wedges for extra brightness. This dish works wonderfully as a side for a taco night, a potluck, or a casual barbecue with friends. For family gatherings, consider serving it alongside a simple green salad dressed with lime vinaigrette to balance the richness of the casserole.

#

Mexican Street Corn Casserole

45 min
$15
320 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

Main CourseSide Dish

Tags:

CasseroleEasyComfort Food

Description

A deliciously creamy and cheesy casserole inspired by the flavors of Mexican street corn, perfect for a hearty family meal.

Ingredients

  • frozen corn: 2 cups
  • cream cheese: 8 oz
  • sour cream: 1 cup
  • shredded cheddar cheese: 1 cup
  • cotija cheese: 1/2 cup
  • chili powder: 1 tsp
  • cumin: 1 tsp
  • garlic powder: 1/2 tsp
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • fresh cilantro: 1/4 cup, chopped
  • lime juice: 2 tbsp

11/17/2024
